data.title: Past Honorees & Speakers
data.meta_description:
PAST HONOREES & SPEAKERS

2023

Honorees: Michael Findlay, Director of Acquavella Galleries
Introduction: Michael Royce, Executive Director, New York Foundation for the Arts
In Conversation: Judd Tully, Art Critic and Journalist

2022

Honorees: Nancy Olnick & Giorgio Spanu, Co-founders, Magazzino Italian Art Foundation
Keynote Speaker: Emily Braun, Ph.D, Distinguished Professor, Hunter College and The Graduate Center, CUNY
In Conversation: Adam D. We...
data.text:
2023

Honorees: Michael Findlay, Director of Acquavella Galleries

Introduction: Michael Royce, Executive Director, New York Foundation for the Arts

In Conversation: Judd Tully, Art Critic and Journalist

2022

Honorees: Nancy Olnick & Giorgio Spanu, Co-founders, Magazzino Italian Art Foundation

Keynote Speaker: Emily Braun, Ph.D, Distinguished Professor, Hunter College and The Graduate Center, CUNY

In Conversation: Adam D. Weinberg, Alice Pratt Brown Director, Whitney Museum of American Art

2019

Honoree: Johnnetta Betsch Cole, PhD, and Mickalene Thomas, artist

In Conversation, Moderated by: Lucy Kaylin, Editor in Chief, O, The Oprah Magazine

2018

Honoree: Hans Ulrich Obrist, Artistic Director, Serpentine Galleries

Video Introduction: Michael R. Bloomberg, Founder, Bloomberg Philanthropies and Bloomberg LP. New York City Mayor 2002-2013

Introduction by: Patricia E. Harris, Chief Executive Officer, Bloomberg Philanthropies

In Conversation with: Ian Cheng, Artist

2017

Honoree: Jeffrey Deitch, Curator and Dealer

Introduction by: Jeff Koons, Artist

In Conversation with: Josh Baer, Art Advisor, Baer Faxt

2016

Honoree: Frank Stella, Artist

Keynote Speaker: Thomas Crow, Ph.D., Rosalie Solow Professor of Modern Art; Associate Provost for the Arts, Institute of Fine Arts, NYU

In Conversation with: Lindsay Pollock, Editor in Chief, Art in America

2015

Honoree: Ilya and Emilia Kabakov, Artists,

Keynote Speaker: Robert Storr, Dean, School of Art, Yale University School of Art

2014

Honoree: Peter Schjeldahl, Art Critic, The New Yorker

Keynote Speaker: Massimiliano Gioni, Associate Director and Director of Exhibitions, The New Museum of Contemporary Art, New York

In conversation with: Ben Brantley, Chief Theater Critic, The New York Times

2013

Honoree: Ai Weiwei, Artist and Activist

Keynote Speaker: Ann Temkin, Chief Curator of Painting and Sculpture, The Museum of Modern Art

Remarks: Jerome A. Cohen, Professor of Law, New York UniversIty School of Law

2012

Honoree: Linda Nochlin, Professor of Modern Art, Institute of Fine Arts/NYU

Keynote Speaker: Tamar Garb, Professor in the History of Art, UCL

In conversation with: Elizabeth Baker, Editor at Large, Art in America, NY

Remarks: Agnes Gund, President Emerita, Museum of Modern Art

2011

Honoree: Arne Glimcher, Founder and President, Pace Gallery, NY

In conversation with: Lindsay Pollock, Editor, Art in America, NY

Remarks: Richard Armstrong, Director, Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum, NY

2010

Honoree: Martin Z. Margulies, Collector and Philanthropist, Miami, FL

In conversation with: Henry Buhl, Collector and Philanthropist, NY

Conversation moderator: Lindsay Pollock, Writer, Reporter, NY

Remarks: James Rosenquist, Artist, NY

2009

Honoree: Thomas Krens, Senior Advisor, The Solomon R. Guggenheim Foundation, NY

Speaker: Jeff Koons, Artist, NY

2008

Honoree: John Richardson, Art Historian and Biographer, NY

Speaker: Rosamond Bernier, Art Historian, NY

Remarks: Geza von Habsburg, Faberge Curatorial Director, NY

Remarks: David Nash, Mitchell-Innes & Nash Gallery, NY

2007

Honoree: Wendell D. Garrett, Senior Consultant, Sothebyâ€™s, NY

Keynote Speaker: Carrie Rebora Barratt, Curator, Metropolitan Museum of Art, NY

Remarks: Morrison H. Heckscher, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, NY

2006

Honorees: Christo and Jeanne-Claude, Artists, NY

Keynote Speaker: Charles Hill, Private Investigator, Hill Art Risk, London

Presentation: Dodie Kazanjian, Arts Editor, Vogue Magazine, NY

Remarks: Suzanne Smeaton, Gallery Director, Eli Wilner & Co., NY

2005
